words.def: Acceleration – the rate of change of velocity with respect to time
words.name: Acceleration

words.def: Ampère's circuital law – relates a circulating magnetic field to an electric current passing through a loop
words.name: Ampère's circuital law

words.def: Atom – smallest unit of a chemical element, which is the cause for property of a matter.
words.name: Atom

words.def: Boltzmann constant – a physical constant relating temperature to energy
words.name: Boltzmann constant

words.def: Chaos theory – the study of processes in nonlinear dynamical systems, such as the Butterfly effect
words.name: Chaos theory

words.def: Classical mechanics – a set of laws describing the motion of bodies and their aggregations
words.name: Classical mechanics

words.def: Coulomb's Law – the force of attraction or repulsion acting between charged bodies
words.name: Coulomb's Law

words.def: Crystal – a regular ordering of atoms, molecules, or ions
words.name: Crystal

words.def: Choke coil – an inductance used in an AC circuit to control current
words.name: Choke coil

words.def: Determinism – classical physics is largely deterministic
words.name: Determinism

words.def: Dip (δ) – the angle between magnetic meridian and geographical meridian.
words.name: Dip (δ)

words.def: Elastic collision – a collision during which no kinetic energy is lost
words.name: Elastic collision

words.def: Electric current – the flow of electric charge through an object
words.name: Electric current

words.def: Electrical resistance – a measure of the degree to which an object opposes the passage of electric current
words.name: Electrical resistance

words.def: Energy – a measure of being able to do mechanical work
words.name: Energy

words.def: Electromotive force – the amount of energy gained per unit charge that passes through a device in the opposite direction to the electric field existing across that device
words.name: Electromotive force

words.def: Eddy currents – changing magnetic flux linked with metal plate produces induced current which flow in closed paths throughout the body of the metal
words.name: Eddy currents

words.def: Force – an external cause for acceleration in a physical system
words.name: Force

words.def: Free energy – the maximum energy available to do useful work
words.name: Free energy

words.def: Gravity – an attractive force between particles with mass
words.name: Gravity

words.def: Geomagnetism – the branch of physics which deals with the study of earth's magnetic field
words.name: Geomagnetism

words.def: Hamiltonian mechanics – a reformulation of Lagrangian mechanics
words.name: Hamiltonian mechanics

words.def: Ideal gas – a gas consisting of identical particles of negligible volume, with no intermolecular forces
words.name: Ideal gas

words.def: Inertia – a historical concept of resistance offered by objects to external force when applied
words.name: Inertia

words.def: Joule's law – equation for the heat generated by a current flowing in a conductor
words.name: Joule's law

words.def: Kinetic energy – energy due to motion
words.name: Kinetic energy

words.def: Lagrangian – a function describing the equations of motion for a system
words.name: Lagrangian

words.def: Lagrangian mechanics – an abstract reformulation of classical mechanics
words.name: Lagrangian mechanics

words.def: Light – a form of energy, which causes sensation of sight
words.name: Light

words.def: Macroscopic – attribute used for objects and processes observable by the naked eye
words.name: Macroscopic

words.def: Mass – a measure of the amount of matter
words.name: Mass

words.def: Maxwell's equations – four equations that describe electric and magnetic fields, and their interaction with matter
words.name: Maxwell's equations

words.def: Molecule – a group of atoms joined by chemical bonds
words.name: Molecule

words.def: Momentum – the product of mass and velocity
words.name: Momentum

words.def: Magnetic field – the space around a magnet or a current within which its magnetic influence can be detected or experienced
words.name: Magnetic field

words.def: Newton's laws of motion – the three laws of Isaac Newton, published in Philosophiae Naturalis Principia Mathematica in 1687
words.name: Newton's laws of motion

words.def: Newtonian mechanics – the first formulation of classical mechanics
words.name: Newtonian mechanics

words.def: Ohm's law – relationship between the current flowing in a conductor and the voltage difference between its ends
words.name: Ohm's law

words.def: Potential energy – energy stored when doing work against a force
words.name: Potential energy

words.def: Quantum mechanics – the theory that separates classical and modern physics
words.name: Quantum mechanics

words.def: Resonance – the tendency of a system to absorb more energy at its resonance frequency in a given process
words.name: Resonance

words.def: Semiclassical – refers to a combination of classical mechanics and quantum mechanics
words.name: Semiclassical

words.def: Special theory of relativity – a theory published in 1905 by Albert Einstein that replaced Newton's notions of space and time
words.name: Special theory of relativity

words.def: Statistical mechanics – the application of mathematical statistics to the collective motions of large populations of particles
words.name: Statistical mechanics

words.def: Temperature – the average kinetic energy of molecules
words.name: Temperature

words.def: Thermodynamics – the study of thermal processes in physical systems
words.name: Thermodynamics

words.def: Ultraviolet catastrophe – a false prediction made by classical mechanics preceding quantum mechanics
words.name: Ultraviolet catastrophe

words.def: Velocity – the rate of change of position with respect to time.
words.name: Velocity

words.def: Wave – a disturbance that propagates in a periodically repeating fashion, often transferring energy
words.name: Wave

words.def: Work – energy transferred by a force
words.name: Work

words.def: X-rays – a form of ionizing electromagnetic radiation and magnetical ambiance's
words.name: X-rays

words.def: Young's modulus – a measure of the stiffness of a body or material
words.name: Young's modulus
